words.defineEn: render holy by means of religious rites
words.defineVi: làm thánh bằng các nghi thức tôn giáo

examples: The relationship between the two friends had deteriorated beyond repair.
She could only watch from the sidelines as her brother's health deteriorated.
Back at the plant, the situation was deteriorating.
So, over time, it deteriorates.
But unlike wallpaper, a painting isn’t necessarily going to deteriorate over time.
words.defineEn: in an ornate manner
words.defineVi: một cách trang trí công phu

words.defineEn: be deliberately ambiguous or unclear in order to mislead or withhold information
words.defineVi: cố tình mơ hồ hoặc không rõ ràng để đánh lừa hoặc che giấu thông tin

examples: You were eradicating the pension for new teachers.
The US government eradicated them from Yellowstone in the 20th century.
Since the introduction of Jonas Salk’s polio vaccine in 1955, the disease has been nearly eradicated from Earth.
This phenomenon can help eradicate stubborn blood cancers.
The ultimate goal would be to eradicate HIV completely.
words.defineEn: kill in large numbers
words.defineVi: giết hàng loạt

examples: Vaccinate your kids, people.
Only 11 percent of Brazil's population is fully vaccinated.
And no country can simply vaccinate its way out of this pandemic.
Ah, vaccinated.
You have got to vaccinate people.
words.defineEn: to protect a person or an animal against a disease by giving them a vaccine
words.defineVi: để bảo vệ một người hoặc một con vật chống lại một căn bệnh bằng cách cho họ vắc-xin

examples: Procrastinating on a project until the last minute is asking for stress and can increase the likelihood of a poor outcome.
The student kept procrastinating on their assignments and projects, and eventually learned the hard way that delays are dangerous when they failed their exams.
If you continue to procrastinate, you'll be asking for trouble.
I always remind myself that one today is worth two tomorrows, so I try to make the most of each day and not procrastinate.
Some procrastinated their schoolwork through other productive tasks, like cleaning or working on other assignments.
words.defineEn: postpone or delay needlessly
words.defineVi: trì hoãn hoặc trì hoãn không cần thiết

examples: I deliberated too long before accepting the job offer, and now they've given it to someone else.
You know, this idea of recognition of self mortality, deliberate body disposal.
The Tolkien reference is deliberate and heavy-handed in the paper, too.
It was a deliberate act.
Chipotle's now quintessential minimalist layout wasn't a deliberate design decision.
words.defineEn: discuss the pros and cons of an issue
words.defineVi: thảo luận về những ưu và nhược điểm của một vấn đề

examples: Could you articulate the sides in that in Washington?
You would actually articulate that.
He also found some articulated vertebrae and some fragmented bones below those ribs.
So some people have described that as being really articulate.
You just articulated to me, as I was saying at the beginning, and I wasn't just talking off the top of my head.
words.defineEn: to clearly and verbally express what one thinks or feels
words.defineVi: để thể hiện rõ ràng và bằng lời nói những gì một người nghĩ hoặc cảm thấy

examples: In advanced cases, the skin of the animal will become thicker and darker in color, and their body may be emaciated.
words.defineEn: grow weak and thin or waste away physically
words.defineVi: phát triển yếu và mỏng hoặc lãng phí thể chất

examples: These carcasses contaminate drinking water, while feral dogs and rats carry the diseases into human communities.
We haven’t contaminated the entire planet or anything.
And contaminated clothes should be washed multiple times separately from the rest of a person’s laundry.
Any pollution on the surface can rapidly seep into and contaminate groundwater.
Some of these districts are contaminated so badly that they will be uninhabitable for decades.
words.defineEn: to make a place, substance, etc. dirty or harmful by adding dangerous material
words.defineVi: để làm cho một nơi, chất, v.v. bẩn hoặc có hại bằng cách thêm vật liệu nguy hiểm

examples: Racism must be eliminated, roots and all.
A little research goes a long way to help eliminate college debt.
We've restructured the organization to help eliminate unnecessary costs, but we're still not out of the woods.
The only wireless part about it is eliminating the wire between your phone and the charger.
Genetic engineering eliminates this factor.
words.defineEn: to fully remove or get rid of something
words.defineVi: để loại bỏ hoàn toàn hoặc thoát khỏi một cái gì đó

examples: And modulating your stress.
Third, the body's enzymes, hormones, nerves, and blood all work together to break down food, modulate the digestive process, and deliver its final products.
Drug developers have tapped venoms for drugs that modulate the immune system, keep blood from clotting, shrink tumors, and kill microbes.
ACE2 does lots of other things, too, like accelerating tissue repair and modulating the microbes in our guts.
Mother's milk for example, contains special sugars that are meant to feed and support certain groups of microbes, work as a decoy for others, and help to modulate the immune system.
words.defineEn: adjust the pitch, tone, or volume of
words.defineVi: điều chỉnh cao độ, âm sắc hoặc âm lượng của

examples: - Yeah, it's un adulterated.

As with any costly ingredient, argan oil products are often adulterated.
Demand for the threads is so high that many adulterate or produce fake saffron.
words.defineEn: corrupt, debase, or make impure by adding a foreign or inferior substance; often by replacing valuable ingredients with inferior ones

words.defineVi: từ chối hoặc từ bỏ

examples: Cultivating personal style and inner confidence will be more enduring than just following the latest fads.

The woman had always tried to be friends with everyone, but when she needed support during a difficult time, she realized that all men's friend is no man's friend, and that she needed to focus on cultivating deeper, more authentic connections.
Maybe the real trick to survival is cultivating your sensitive side, for hundreds of millions of years.
Putin cultivated the image of a reformer and a democrat.
Roy cultivated an image as a bulldog.
words.defineEn: to raise crops or grow plants
words.defineVi: để trồng trọt hoặc trồng cây

examples: The vacation provided Julia with a new lease on life, rejuvenating her spirit.

The retiree took up a new hobby and felt rejuvenated, realizing that a man is as old as he feels himself to be.
So New York is constantly being rejuvenated, we often say, by immigrants, and it is being rejuvenated by new cultures.
And so to make a new one may not be possible, versus to rejuvenate an old one might be the best-case scenario.
words.defineEn: make younger or more youthful
words.defineVi: làm cho trẻ hơn hoặc trẻ trung hơn

examples: - Other people emulated them.

examples: The corrugated box could be about to undergo a major facelift.

In those shift by Amazon have made the corrugated industry rethink the way it does business.
Men tried to get out through the gaps in the corrugated iron sheets that formed the walls.
Until Scotty on the Enterprise can beam the products from the warehouse to your living room I think Amazon's gonna be good for the corrugated business.
